      • fetchArrayOfRows

        public String[] fetchArrayOfRows(int minSize)
                          throws IOException
        Parameters:
        minSize - Minimum size of the result. If the file is compressed, the result may be much larger. The reading starts at the current position in the file, and stops once the limit has been reached.
        Returns:
        An array of result rows.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException
        IOException

      • fetchArrayOfRows

        public String[] fetchArrayOfRows(int startOffset,
                        int stopOffset)
                          throws IOException
        Read a block of data from the file and return it as an array of rows. First sync to startOffset, and skip the first row, then keep reading Until passing stopOffset and passing the next Sync marker.
        Parameters:
        startOffset -
        stopOffset -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException
        IOException

      • fetchNextRow

        public String fetchNextRow(long stopOffset)
                    throws IOException
        Fetch the next row from the file.
        Parameters:
        stopOffset - File offset at which to start looking for a sync marker
        Returns:
        The next row, or null if we have reached EOF or have passed stopOffset and then the sync marker.
        Throws:
        IOException
